intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis ringens, commonly known as the silver orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, pale green leaves and produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers with a distinctive, intricate pattern. It is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in terrariums or as a houseplant. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is relatively difficult to grow outside its native range.
